GZEhiCNl58H6DNdTMR8m1w.text: Had shepherds pie. Hrd to find that in the south, so we tried it. It was good, the fish and chips were ok too. For the neighborhood which is filled with tourist traps or overpriced food, this is one place to try

_a3kPlxCuLpslxRsw3tdOw.text: Great Pub with a sweet owner and friendly staff! Thursday through Saturday there's live music which shouldn't be missed. We liked the breakfast a lot, fresh ingredients, good portions. Two of us are vegetariens and one doesn't like tomatoes  no problem, all of our special requests were happily taken care of. When we came back a few days later for a pint the owner recognised us which I think is amazing in a town like London and a sign that he really cares about his customers. The pub itself is the regular, cozy English kind of pub, just the way you want it to be. Highly recommended and absolutely easy to reach as it is located within 50m of Lancaster Gate station.

l25PeRSZ23bRPT6qELq5pg.text: Nice spot to sit outside and watch the peole - some mediocre croning on weekend nights to a Karaoke machine, but it's live music and authentic (but not great) fish & chips.

RJGXFlSAMUoyutw-DbLWJQ.text: Friendly staff, prime location, outdoor seating and a view of Hyde Park.

tI2lnJjAXot-mhcCkxk1qA.text: Near Hyde Park. Ample outdoor seating creates a great beer garden meets pub atmosphere. Perfect for a pint on a sunny day.

2QnY7bNE2Kq7a51G5b4GQQ.text: Visited The Swan on a recommendation from the hotel concierge. I ordered the fish n chips and a pint of the London Pride. Their service was attentive recognizing that we may be tourists not familiar with ordering at the bar. The guy that owned the bar and his sons were very friendly. We visited there a few times before we departed for our next destination. We will definitely return if we are ever in London near Hyde Park again. It's just around the corner from Lancaster Station. Cheers!

EgD6EVokECZz59De7kiJAg.text: I've been visiting The Swan for years.  Ali and his staff are always welcoming and helpful.  We had an eyeopening experience last visit.  it was a beautiful April evening, and a friend and I were enjoying a pint on the patio.  As we were chatting, a couple of lads had a scuffle with a patron just beside us.  My friend told me to run inside and get help, but I noticed our bartender was already outside.  Before we could think, a young man asked my friend, "Is this your wallet?"  The kerfuffle was the reaction of two employees shaking down the pickpocket who had just nicked my mate's wallet from her purse AT HER FEET!!!  Moral:  Don't take your eyes or hands off your bags!!  This keen staff saved our holiday!  Cheers lads!!  I'll be back!

e9vytitQyMotddHCRS3HpA.text: A really lovely warm welcoming olde world pub whih serves excellent food at reasonable prices. Always busy but luckily always found a seat available. They have heaters in the sheltered outside area which even made a chilly January seem warm. They advertise a carvery but really it's just a Roast Dinner but still very tasty....also very nice Steak there

20h1edfENgOdcOOeVfyn0A.text: The Swan is my favorite pub in Chiswick. The food is great - the Sunday roast is a fantastic plate. The staff are excellent. Liz from Australia is a particular favorite. Best of all they love dogs - my two boxers Ronnie and Lucy are always enthusiastically received and brought water and attention. Always made me feel very welcome.

6kl7m8MrbLh7MgRlyacIRA.text: This place may be old, but their service is horrible. Don't get suckered into this tourist trap.

f-lnT34BCqp_IINjD6Ol4A.text: I thought it would be terribly touristy located in Bayswater, but the food was really tasty, the drinks were great, and they didn't mind that I had a very young baby and pram with me. Great staff, I would go there again!

crct0LRL3ay05tHQ3DabVw.text: Warm and friendly atmosphere and a very hard working yet pleasant staff Would totally recommend it for tourists looking for the authentic pub experience with large portions of nourishing food.

Smtw5z1QSN_R0pRX2cGIkg.text: My husband and I loved hanging out at The Swan every night after a day exploring London. Drinking beers outside on the front porch is a really good time.

sjlRmwgUwjkn4qnjJZQXjQ.text: The Swan has a wonderfully rich history being the final drinking point for prisoners on their way to the gallows at Marble Arch and is nicely positioned overlooking Kengsington Gardens (and near the Lancaster Gate tube station or a little ways from Queensway tube station). The food is pretty darn good and the service has gotten better (but still spotty sometimes) since they remodeled. The fish and chips are a tasty staple and they offer a variety of other dishes (more than just pub grub) and side dishes. The selection of beer on tap including hard cider is on par with most UK pubs.

9iLfYIE5mtux77DS29qVkQ.text: Large outdoor patio. Lots of smokers.  Very busy. Didn't eat the food. just another fuller's pub.

OXA3lUmON8KQv_EOh8wdzw.text: This pub is very close to Lancaster Tube station and opposite Hyde Park. I went there for the first time on Saturday and it was the perfect place to have a pint after a day in the sun in the park. It was rammed on Saturday afternoon; everybody was trying to get a table in the outdoor patio at the front of the pub. There is also a terrace which overlooks the park but that was hired out for a private party when I was there, so we were unable to sit up top. The pub is rather basic and nothing special but they do serve cheap food and you they have roast lunch already cooked up so you can eat really quickly if you are starving (or in a rush).

j76rn-dONtpG2WKLfzZN2A.text: As far as my London pub experience goes, this was a darn good pub!My boy was commenting on the flat beer but I'm not a beer-drinker so I don't know. The ambience was cheerful and Puby (if there's such a word) The food was delicious!Don't believe when people tell you the food in UK is horrible - it's just simply not true! London has so many great restaurants!

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Right in front of Hyde Park

29U1kV31kEn1SbqhJhC0ew.text: Located next to Hyde Park, The Swan has a lovely outside seating area to enjoy a pint or any meal. My friends and I stopped in for lunch. I ordered the nachos  which were not that good however my friends ordered  fish n chips and really enjoyed it. Despite my choice for lunch I would still recommend The Swan to anyone so stop in and check it out for yourself.

o2GXJzWahn9I5ltTuQKG_w.text: The Swan was recommended as "good pub food" and I was not disappointed. I had the steak pie and would definitely come back and order it again. Very good selection of beers and friendly staff (even though they were very busy).

RPR-emT4Gq_WpMH2JPAohg.text: Good food and reasonably priced. Great atmosphere also. Only things I didn't like was ordering a burger with no choice but well done  and having to go up and down stairs from the second floor to order drinks,  then food, then dessert. But the burger ended up being good anyway and I got over the stairs. If you're staying near Bayswater area give it a go.

3pkmczZzJR1OUG17GVQgUA.text: This review is based on a visit in late September 2011 -- better late than never, I suppose!My friend and I had our first London dinner here, as it was right down the street from our hotel, and we enjoyed it.  For those used to American table service, it is a pub and leans a little more toward being a counter service type of establishment...order and pay at the bar, and your food is delivered to you.We ordered potato wedges to share, my friend had the fish and chips, and I had the steak and ale pie.  My friend also ordered an ale, and I think I ordered a glass of wine (since I'm not much of a beer drinker - I know, that's quite a shame whilst in London!).  I would skip the potato wedges the next time, it wasn't really my cup of tea.  It also came at the same time as our entrees, which were more than adequate.My friend enjoyed her fish and chips, which was basically a whole fish (or maybe half a fish).  Definitely NOT the kinds of fish strips or mini-fish fillets we are used to here in the U.S.!  My steak and ale pie was delish as well, served with mashed potatoes and steamed veggies.  This made for a wonderful first dinner in a London pub atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips, potato wedges, and steak and ale pie (back to front)

CZjlnxtXcEPMdi6SIEIjag.text: How did I miss out on the pub side of this fine establishment?  I had breakfast at The Swan after passing it a few times on my way to tours leaving from the Marble Arch.  Hearty, delicious, and delightfully surprised that they served it with a sauce that resembled A1 sauce.  It was the perfect English Breakfast (probably more than the typical person should eat, but hey, it's vacation!)I will be back for the beer!

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. English Breakfast...very very tasty!

pFc2ja5Sj1ZztVVgGdJn-A.text: Great night spot.  Got the fish and chips. They were everything I've been craving since we got to London.  Good selection of beers and we enjoyed quite a few.  Sat outside in front.  Met some great people and had a wonderful evening.  A must on any visit to London from now on.

oyp_Gi_eoSQ1cRGOitOzQg.text: Good, solid English pub. Order at the bar and the food is delivered to your table. The waitstaff was extremely friendly and funny, and the food was quite correct. It's a pub, not a gastro-pub, and that's what you get: spot on British fare from fried whitebait (tasty starter!) to chicken and mushroom pies with mashed potatoes, gravy, and overcooked carrots. We needed a quick lunch on a cold afternoon--after an overnight, transatlantic flight--and the Swan it the spot. The daily special salad was crayfish and avocado, and came with boiled potatoes, arugula, and lemon and was light, fresh, and filling. Also generous glass pours of wine at very reasonable rates. I recommend the South African Chenin Blanc.I'd go back, which says enough in and of itself. Or so I'd like to think.

iI2SnKwy8Sl-jTPdYaXJnQ.text: I walked in and the place looks like any other nice traditional English pub. Apparently the menu and food are pretty good here, but I didn't eat. I just stopped in for a quick pint while waiting for a friend to arrive at nearby Lancaster Gate station. The staff are friendly enough and the place is very clean. I was in and out but I would recommend it.

W1qzYBlJiJPfx8REAqURPg.text: £9 for a measly few nachos and it took a considerable time for someone, anyone to bring me my beer.The barman assumed that, since I said I was from California, I would prefer a lighter, bubblier beer. Wrong, sir. (Certainly, if anyone appreciates a good IPA, it's a Californian. Not that I am one, being from New York.) When the beer I did order remained to be seen, even after my wife had gone through half of hers, our sad nachos arrived. I queried the server about my beer and was told shortly that she only dealt with the food and I'd have to hail the barman to deal with it. Certainly, after I did as such, the beer arrived quickly. But the weak nachos and the poor service, not to mention the odd assortment of covers being played curiously by the house band, caused me to finish up quickly and head off before more damage could be done.

GoKjfuLGF89M_L3wP3s-kA.text: Very Good! Had wings as a starter. Very good. My steak was cooked perfectly. The chips were outstanding

OUyiSc1gB5wnFHpU93rXNw.text: First time here and having honey dew beer... interesting. I came here to meet friends who were in town for the Olympics because they actually HAD tickets. Word to the wise, depending on where you are on Oxford St and how fit you're feeling, DON'T WALK. We looked at the map from Russell Square and thought to take the leisurely stroll over. 1 hour later we arrived. Good to know. Busy because of the games, but HUGE place. Looks like a colonial house... kind of. Lots of seating, pretty clean toilets and an upstairs, downstairs outside set up. Not sure if that was just for the games or if that's all the time. Although they were busy, the staff were quick, attentive and fun! It's not my local, but when I'm in the Hyde Park area I think I will come back

staEAk70x8WYE1_VXmbmcA.text: Worst fish I've had ever. Gray, freezer burn taste and hard to chew. My husband's sausage was fresh and very tasty with nicely seasoned sautéed onions and plenty of rich brown gravy. Service very slow. Definitely a tourist trap.

VBrfhzFwSt91IqO7-Uvckw.text: We made a quick stop in London and ended up here twice. The Fish and Chips were great! Beer was delicious and the service was good. We had the lasagna too which wasn't our favorite thing. I'd avoid that. They also had a band one night and the games were on the TV. What more could you ask for?

OaoD7M2HjYJ5V1gmhth9EQ.text: Right after my husband and I checked into our hotel we turned the corner to this pub.  We were starving and thirsty, and were excited that this place was so close.  After getting a beer each and ordering Fish and Chips we settled into our meal.  We sat outside, and had a great time.  The staff and other patrons were enjoyable, and we felt a bit like celebrities as a couple of Londoners chatted us up about America and the upcoming presidential election (this was Oct. 2012 for reference).  It was a great experience and great food.We will definitely come back on our next trip.

oXKljnnEZIVofS09_WgyqA.text: Hubby and I grabbed a couple drinks a few times at the Swan because our hotel was located right down the street from the pub and we would pass it every time we went to/returned from the tube (I heart the TUBE!). I loved how quaint and historical it looked. It was awesome being able to sit down outside (or inside) and have a pint after a long and exhausting, but absolutely wonderful, day of exploring London. The inside is nice and dark and woody and loud. Since Hubby's younger brother is studying in London, we brought him to the Swan one night, and it was nice to throw back snakebites, ciders, and beers, and to have lovely conversation at near-scream voice levels inside (there was a live band playing inside that night). Another plus for me was the fact that it is located right across the street from the park and therefore offered nice views of lush, beautiful trees.I miss London pubs.

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. The Swan

oupaFYgKB15dBkVQl0_IEA.text: A decent pub located directly on the Bayswater Road, very near to Lancaster Gate Tube Station, and right across from Hyde Park. The beer range is limited to Fuller's but that's not an entirely bad thing. A nice, traditional spot to drink some London-made cask ales. A place to visit out of convenience, not a place to make an effort visiting.

RAOJDJ1hDrrx4LHP_PkE2w.text: Really nice pub. Whether you are sitting outside or in, the atmosphere is amazing. Hyde Park is on the other side of the street and the greenery offers a relaxing view. There's also live music on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays, which makes the experience ever more enjoyable.

xo6HJyTldsHJXWg5NXEqzA.text: I love The Swan.I come here all the time, especially when Mom is in town and staying at the hotel next door. The interior encapsulates exactly what I expect from an English pub: sturdy wooden tables that are great for groups, richly colored, and cozy. There's an outdoor area in the front with long tables and heat lamps that is nice in the fall, but still too chilly in the winter.The drink selection is good, although I admit I always go for the Aspall cider on tap (delicious). They have live music on certain nights, which always seems to fall on the nights I'm there, and I really enjoy it. It can get pretty loud, but if you find the right table it's ideal. Now, the tough part. I love this place, and if you do too, and you want to continue to enjoy it, do not eat the food. Just don't. Okay, you can have the cheese platter or some chips for a nibble, but that's it.There will be tests of your resolve. You will be tempted by the trendy handwritten chalkboard menu. And the carvery set up at the bar. And the upstairs seating area reserved for meals only. Remember: this place is not for meals, it is for relaxing after a long walk in Hyde Park or enjoying drinks with a group of friends. It is great for those things. If you are a tourist who has been traipsing around London with a group all day in the bitter cold and your feet hurt and you want to warm up in an old English pub (with the requisite morbid historical backstory) with a pint, then welcome to The Swan. You'll love it here. If you're hungry, then move on.In summation: pints with friends, yes. Food- wise: perpetuates every stereotype out there about English cuisine (many of which I don't agree with.)

Ac1WP_-vA-T7FAzS_TfnLw.text: Popped in on a dreary Sunday for a roast lunch with some friends and found it very warm and comforting. The food was pretty good but what was outstanding was the service. We needed some hot water to warm up some baby formula - but unlike other places we've been to - the staff were very sympathetic and gave us hot water almost immediately. A simple request, quickly added upon. The food was pretty good too and worth the cost of £10 for a Sunday roast.

k49JYV8Y2iw5QNIJjVwSBQ.text: Had my first pub/fish and chips experience here after a long walk through Hyde park. Great selection of beer and the batter on the fish was light and crispy, only gripe is they kept the fish skin on..blech. I also tried mashed peas for the first time, but I was not a fan.

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Loved the outdoor seating.

xAYuQeDIDRLfagv_K6l56w.text: Food is mediocre. Atmosphere in the pub is ok but not great. Beer options are fine but weak on microbrews.

rRSB0P9o2Pi6blcHqh4IAw.text: Great pub atmosphere and good pub food right across the street from Hyde Park. We ended up eating here 3 different nights during our vacation because of the quality food and convenient location to our hotel. Staff is friendly and the place is always filled with people, especially on Fri, Sat, and Sun when they have live music.

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Beef burger with cheese and chips: 13.50
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips: 13.00

JYa73v8EXBqIDollydcIrQ.text: Great fun pub! Went on a Saturday night to watch a soccer game and they had live music afterwards!

TiLBLR_kOK_3XzXiN2xV9Q.text: Lovely place to watch the world go by - with outdoor seating and an upstairs balcony. Roomy inside with friendly staff. Menu looks good and the food that I've seen looks well prepared. Definitely going to become my go to place when the inevitable train delays occur at Paddington.

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Busy Saturday prior to the Proms

F8EFCRWrFKWGAh_IqcEggA.text: Stop by for dinner and went upstairs.  Their was one table for four available.  I was alone.  The attendance plainly told me nothing is available since I'm alone and guided me out.  There was one table with 2 gentlemen at a table for four who allowed me to sit with them. Not a good initial impress of the establishment.I order my drink and food.  Before receiving either, the check was provided for me to pay.  Apparently, they assume their patrons are criminals and require payment before drink or food in case we run off.While meeting and talking with my new table mates was great, I will not visit this establishment again.

3CMfWTJx48onG6exQCOUCA.text: Food: We shared the fish and chips. The fish had a very good batter on it with seasoning. It was also lighter than it looked. The chips were really good as well. I liked the seasoning on them. We didn't really get into the peas but that is a matter of personal preference. The vinegar was also more in line with what we are used to being malt vinegar. Good selection of beer as well.Service: The staff was friendly and the food came out in a timely manner.Overall: We would definitely go back to this place for the fish and chips and beer. It has a nice cozy atmosphere as well to just sit back and have a beer.

HPFFdEnQ-xgzXxfEhIXluA.text: Very British!Just finished a delicious dinner. Fish and chips, of course! Very good, even the mushy peas. Also ordered  chili, but didn't care for the taste. The manager came and INSISTED that it be replaced immediately with an item of our choice. Got the cheesecake and it was outstanding. Now that's the way you run a restaurant! Love to come back but it's a long way from home.

om_lW329TVS3PY_WyriVVw.text: Haven't tried upstairs but downstairs is aNice, fairly traditional, London pub. Good food and plentiful tv's making it one of the better spots in the neighborhood for catching football games. They also have good outdoor seating on the street with a giant big screen facing towards that area making it especially nice. Sunday Roast can run out fairly early but is good :).

kxR9tM7XBDo97UIizKS9qA.text: Very good english pubs. An amount of beers choice. We loves the ale ones (nicholsons, london pride, etc.) Fish and chips were realmy great too

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Inside
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Nicholsons ale

vu9PaGxkKmRfFix4N4yc6A.text: Our first night in London, tired but looking forward to this pub with lots of history, we went for the Fish & Chips. Being american we were looking for good, authentic fish & chips. While it was good, I couldn't say it was very good as we prefer our fish to be cleaned of all skin prior to cooking. Loved the vibe, the service was very friendly. We don't drink beer and they do serve alcohol. We had vodka and cranberry. Would return (and we did, for breakfast , will write a separate review) Would recommend.

Eh6YTB2x3AOV0PYjzUl1-g.text: Not sure what to make of this pub. Nice decor, dark wood and dark red wallpaper. Has an upstairs area that can be booked. As with all Fullers pubs, there own ales are kings. The staff are friendly. I can't think of anything to fault it. One good touch, it has an outside seating area at the front and a large TV inside the front window facing out, probably very popular during sporting occasions. Food seemed to be served all day, well at least up to 4.30 when I was there.

12sUZnuWfPHbnV4N5fmBNg.text: We were a group of four here for evening drinks, unfortunately we forgot to eat.  It's a roomy traditional pub with the usual range in draught and a few interesting choices in the fridge.  They had Franziskaner Weissbier which always makes me happy, though I had to pour it myself.  The atmosphere is very friendly, the staff nice and acceptably competent.  A quiet night with friends?  This place fits the bill.

IZM8Q5CcoMvC7EADLDfKCA.text: Find a seat, go order at the bar, and they will bring it out to you.   Excellent yorkshire pudding and fish/chips.    Deserts including the spotted dick are excellent.  Indoor and outdoor seating available.   Go upstairs if its full down below.  Several beers on tap.  Selection of whiskeys and ports is small though.

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Fish n chips

9fIDZpcQ0yUx4zI2SF6ETg.text: After a long walk on Oxford Street, the bf and I were ready for a nice pint of Guiness. I had a poor man's Black Velvet and he had the Guiness and Black. Drinks were poured perfectly. As for the pub, there are tables outside and a few sitting areas on the first floor. Upstairs has more seating. The decor is nice and it is not too dark inside. I hope to come back to review the food. The Swan also does live music on the weekends.

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Guinness and Black

fK6KvZQgawU7VaUgC6zLdQ.text: Relatively decent pub/bar restaurant. Ordered fish and chips of course and local beer from the Fuller's  brewery, a flat lager that was actually not bad. The fish and chips was good, really large portions, good tarter sauce, friendly atmosphere and directly across from the famous Hyde Park. Would recommend this place if your near by.

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips

iK3F4CoeePTrQOjLHp9P8A.text: Visiting London and stopped by to check it out. Atmosphere was good and the food was delicious! Beyond delicious. English comfort food at its best. Steak and Ale Pie was perfect and the burger looked terrific. A must try when in the Kensington Garden area.

wPpELzu8OqZTLSdClRAaSQ.text: I stayed in London for a week and almost every night at The Swan. Single woman traveling alone, they made me feel so safe and welcome. Their food is awesome and the outdoor seating is a great place to watch a game. What a wonderful neighborhood gem!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Launch a lovely warm spot for a pint! The staff are so sweet!!

d8v_egiqm-inH3DAiBQjAg.text: Just an ok bar near to Hyde Park and Bayswater with a good balcony overlooking Hyde Park upstairs and quite a large terrace on the front,but it's a bit expensive at £4.60 a pint!!! Its a traditional english pub and not at all trendy and it does look a bit tired and worn, Most staff being friendly. I don't think we will go back due to the price of the beer though!

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. 4.60 a pint!!!

R6vvEUuq9KYz0zFu722fpw.text: You have to order at the bar but the beer's good and they had the best wings!  We also had a meat pie that was tasty.  Solid food offerings and good beer.  Not cheap, but nothing in London really is.

q1E5KGh-Gi6nmYS9MDOxTw.text: Great spot with great service.  Magdalena was very helpful and provided outstanding service.  We hope to go back again on our trip.  Great for kids.  Here is a tip- the sticky toffy pudding with ice cream is totally worth it!

b86FIXNHkMPF8FlJJtZ7wA.text: Last day in London. So getting a lovely breakfast before leaving is ideal. Our hotel was located right around the corner from this place, so we decided to leave it for the very last day.When we got to the place, it was fairly empty. Unfortunately, the upstairs with seating overlooking the street was unavailable. So we got outdoor seating downstairs.We quickly got menus and placed our orders. The wait for the food and tea was no more than 10-15 minutes. The Eggs Royal were very tasty and beautifully plated. The teapots with our tea were a very nice touch. The English breakfast tea itself had great flavor too.All around great service, food and drink. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. English breakfast tea with Eggs Royal
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. The breakfast menu

qaCNedtwo0hPkqStsTLIkA.text: Look Swan, I like you. LIKE!  That's from Pee Wee Herman, you won't get it, but my friends in Dallas will. It's cute and in a fantastic location.  I was staying in Bayswater.  I'd been walking around London all day and I was tired and hungry.  The Swan was on my way back to the hotel.  They had a few tables open inside.  Live music was playing, which was fine but the noise level is a bit high. I was alone but really hungry and wanted a small appetizer.  The server helped me pick one and then brought the wrong one.  It was salmon so it was fine but I was having fish & chips as my entree so it was a very fishy evening.  The fish & chips were good except the bones that impaled my tongue.  It was a large portion and the flavor was really good till the stabby part.   The service was a bit spotty but it was busy by the time I left.  I did see some folks come in and see how busy and loud it was and leave.  The place is pretty and I read some interesting history about it.  I'm glad I went there, but I'm not sure it would be my go-to.

NDv9tP9fM6BWjliuaN5vOQ.text: An alright, decent pub on Hyde Park. More a pub for tourists, however, the food is not too bad. It isn't the small cosy pub you'd like but they show football, serves food and cheapish beer. All in all decent - you can go there but no real wow affect....

f3jtu27rp-sly4LdT1HwGg.text: This was a fun place.  We were lucky to find a table upstairs in the balcony.  The ambiance was lively and fun, we noticed it on our way to our hotel so we decided to come and enjoy a couple of cocktails and some food.  We shared the gnocchi, hummus and lamb kafta, but the best part was the amazing sticky toffee pudding, so good!

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom

wIX_PqFKVtmq_QI0Jrx0tA.text: Lovely spot very close to gardens and Lancaster gate tube stop-and block from our rental. Fantastic food and service. Nice lunch specials and some specials that start at 5. Pub was getting busy when we left late afternoon. Would definitely recommend it.

Sv-P0gLI5Vqz3QC4XYaa2A.text: I have orders the lamb salat, the waiter recommended it but the dish was very small and way too expensive!But the service is very nice.If you are hungry I'll recommend you to find another place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom

EfsjJAhcJuufMMfLHVQJDA.text: Love love love! This pub has amazing food and the ambience is great as well. I had the Sunday roast the first night and the steak & London pride pie another night. The pie was absolutely my favorite! I will definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom

_a7EejhdSqItsnKrnRuYjA.text: This is a beautiful pub set in a beautiful location. Have I said beautiful too much? It overlooks Hyde Park. It is a Fullers Pub and so the beer and quality of food is really good. As it is a pub for tourists rather than locals this tends to reflect itself in the atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom

ybwXHcAfX_4wp4M0LrGT0w.text: This place we found as we came out of Hyde Park. I'm so glad we stopped. It was very friendly. A small crowd but not too noisy. I loved the food and the local beer (London Pride) was very good. Will definitely recommend stopping here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom

Q-7jZyYp38yzDx26g4Sorw.text: Absolutely delicious food! We had to sample all of the "traditional" English fare being our last main meal in England prior to heading back to the States. We decided upon Bangers and Mash, London Pride and Fish and Chips (of course!!). The food was all absolutely delicious, but the hands down winner was the fish and chips. The best fish and chips we had while visiting London, by far. The batter was light, crispy and flavorful. The mushy peas were a delight and the tartar sauce was perfect. We were satisfied with the other meals, as well. A couple of Fuller's pints while on the patio followed by a walk through Hyde Park afterwards made for a truly enjoyable experience all around. Highly recommended!!

7j6XQF15lozvtYvVbV1GJw.text: Great pub, the atmosphere, the bar tenders, and the servers make this a great pub. And the history too.Only issue was the night we came half of the menu items were "sold out". I didn't ask if this a normal occurrence but we were limited to Fish n Chips and the chicken meat pie. Which were both excellent but the pub was not that full and it was 7pm in the evening. Good selection of beers. The bartenders are patient and helpful. plus they take credit cardsIf you are staying close by in the Sussex Garden row of hotels and want to kick it with a local crowd with a great atmosphere this is the place!

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Fish n Chips and Chicken Meat Pie both were excellent!
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. A finely poured Guinness to start

vfSZWoYk4C4iWnMO5IFWuQ.text: My wife and I had our anniversary dinner here. It is located just across the street from the Italian Gardens in Hyde Park. We both got the steak pie with chips, peas, carrots and red cabbage. The only complaint I have, and it is a minor one, is the gravy from the pie spilled over on everything on the plate. Other than that the meal was fine. The peas and carrots were properly cooked, Chips were HOT!!! The beef pie was good but a little salty. I didn't eat the red cabbage. The place has the feel of an upscale pub and the service was professional. I recommend this pub.

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. The upper floor of The Swan on Bayswater Road, London.
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Steak and ale pie with chips, peas, carrots, and red cabbage.

BtE59Vqorgttu2W_MEsqVQ.text: Stopped based on Yelp reviews. I had a steak sandwich and ate only half. My companion ordered hamburger with no bun with fries. She loves fries and only ate 1/2 of the burger and 4 fries. She found the other half of the steak sandwich that I didn't like better than the burger. Right on Hyde Park so maybe that's why the high yelp reviews. Certainly not for the food based on our experience.

8WLPE_x8dmIept1KDHMk_A.text: Nice atmosphere and really good food especially for a pub.  Fish and chips for me.  The fish was very tasty with a crispy coat.  The cheddar jacket was fantastic.  Two thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips plus cheddar jacket

nClq0sTlwlqUHVDjgoWufg.text: Decent beer selection although mostly bottled and average food. I had the steak pie which wasn't what I'd call bad... but not great.  Seemed a little like a store bought frozen one from a box, if it came from the freezer section at the grocery store I'd be happy with it.  My girlfriend had the gnocchi which I thought was pretty good.   My big issue was with the service.  Took almost 20 min to get menus after we were seated despite the waiter walking by at least six times.  He seemed a little overwhelmed and I was trying to give them the benefit of the doubt all it would've taken was "sorry I'll be with you in a minute".  I would've left but it was getting late and we were hungry.  After finally getting menus it picked up a bit and we got drinks and food in a reasonable time.  After finishing I ordered another beer and was feeling ok again after the rough start.  After taking my drink order the waiter went to the table behind us and proceeded to have a 15 minute conversation (literally) with the people there while I sat with an empty glass... I was in disbelief.  I eventually turned and said forget the beer and bring the bill. I guess he realized because without saying a word it was brought over... with an unearned service fee included on the bill.

04YY90haAVLVWCp1F8BuSw.text: My partner and I dined here while on vacation in London.Our guide recommended this place because of the history of the place and proximity to our Thistle Hotel on Bayswater.Pros- very nice upscale area. The pub is well kept and nice exterior and interior .  We dined on a Monday evening and the place was packed . We lucked into a table for two which I held while my partner ordered our meal and drinks .  Menu selection is good with a nice choice of meat, seafood and vegetarian items.  Service was prompt and good.  Fish and chips were hot and delicious. My partners burger and fries were also delicious. Wine and beer were very good and prices were reasonable for the area.Cons- popular place and can be difficult to grab a table.  The front porch was full of smokers and the wave of smoke was truly incredible to pass through in order to enter the place.Overall , we really liked the place and would dine here again!

ennoOCbOckhYxSTHXojWaQ.text: Really enjoyed dinner here with the hubby. I was looking forward to the Sunday roast but didn't make it there on Sunday. We had the fish and chips which was ok. Wish the fish was seasoned a bit but it was so blan. Hubby had some thing with mashed potatoes and sausage and it was delish. See pictures

photos.caption: Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Mashed potatoes with Sausage and peas....delish!
Photo of The Swan - London, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips.

v_0xbfCcSaTYCGtW90i1Gw.text: Honestly the best steak pie we had during our entire stay in London.  The American girl behind the bar was so helpful - really made a nice introduction for us, as out-of towners.  Cool layout, and wide demographic (from posh young guys outside having a pint with their mates on the way home, to oldsters having dinner inside) - just a really nice atmosphere.However, the second time we went, the fish in the fish and chips definitely tasted of ammonia.  If you eat fish frequently, you know this means the fish has gone off.  That would be OK, things happen, right, but after we drew it to their attention, the manager wanted to debate it (after they had cleared away the remains).  I told him it tasted like ammonia, he pushed back and said nobody else ever complained...which doesn't mean the fish hadn't gone off (it had).  He thought it was a financial thing, like we wanted a free dinner, to his further discredit....and so, comped it.  We felt like he should refund it, since the fish had gone off, and so, took the comp.  A 2-star experience, but otherwise, the service, and everything else we had here was great, so, plus one star.  Won't be back.

P5H8hwwFYQfrSv8x0hUGXw.text: Worked as a photographer at a birthday party. Very nice venue. Good food and drinks, live music. Highly recommend!
